channel.title: Compression tool
channel.description:
I've figured out how to use my compression tool to compress and decompress rscd files. Problem is, my compression tool wont work. Heres the code that comes up when I try to run any of them,
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: DefCompressor Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: DefCompressor at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: DefCompressor. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Compression tool
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

professionalnoob:

Lol dude, that makes no sense. The point of an rscd file is that its encrypted. gzip files arent encrypted. lol

.rscd is a renamed .gzip, they aren’t encrypted in any special way.

Read full topic

item.title: Compression tool
item.dc:creator: @professionalnoob professionalnoob
item.description:
@professionalnoob wrote:

Lol dude, that makes no sense. The point of an rscd file is that its encrypted. gzip files arent encrypted. lol

item.title: Compression tool
item.dc:creator: @D.Shark D.Shark
item.description:
@D.Shark wrote:

professionalnoob:

cant figure out how to compress the files back to rscd. There is no rscd option, and they wont work saved as anything else. compression tool is the only thing that will put it back into an rscd file.

Just compress and rename the extention to .rscd from .gzip.

Read full topic
